''[[Anthro (comics)|Anthro]]'' | awards = | website = | sortkey = Post, Howard | subcat = American | yob = 1926 | mob = 11 | dob = 2 | yod = 2010 | mod = 5 | dod = 22 }} '''Howard Post''' (November 2, 1926''[[Comics Buyers Guide]]'' #1636 (December 2007); Page 135 – May 21, 2010{{cite news |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hbuvtKFbOU0j5ORQRIozJmVN3AKgD9FTFRN00 |title='Dropouts' cartoonist Howard Post dies in NJ at 83 |work=[[Associated Press]] |publisher=[[Google News]] |date=May 24, 2010 |accessdate=May 25, 2010 }}{{cite news |first=Jay |last=Levin |url=http://www.northjersey.com/obituaries/052410_The_Dropouts_cartoonist_Howard_Post_83_dies.html |title='The Dropouts' cartoonist Howard Post, 83, dies‎ |work=[[The Record (Bergen County)|The Record]] |date=May 24, 2010 |accessdate=May 25, 2010 }} in [[New York City]]) is an [[People of the United States|American]] [[Comic book creator|comic book writer and artist]]. ==Biography== Post worked on many [[comic book]]s featuring ''[[Hot Stuff the Little Devil]]'', ''[[Spooky the Tuff Little Ghost]]'', and ''[[Wendy the Good Little Witch]]'' for [[Harvey Comics]] and ''[[Anthro (comics)|Anthro]]'' for [[DC Comics]]. In addition, Post was the head of [[Paramount Cartoon Studios]], as well as a key director, succeeding [[Seymour Kneitel]] from 1964 through 1965. He also drew and wrote the comic strip ''[[The Dropouts]]'' from 1968 to 1981. ===The Dropouts=== ''The Dropouts'' was a [[comic strip]] created by Howard Post and was syndicated by [[United Features Syndicate]] from 1968 to 1981. The strip was started, according to Post, as a result of his anger over his adventure strip [[Anthro (comics)|Anthro]] being rejected; the premise of The Dropouts was the classic "stranded on a desert island" gag. The two main characters, Alf and Sandy were indeed castaways, but the island they're on is hardly deserted; one of the strips' [[running gag]]s was how closely the natives' society resembled [[Western culture|Western civilization]]. The other characters included a one-man [[police]] force, a doctor, and a chef running a [[cafe]] (his food is inedible); all natives. There were other Western characters, including a religious zealot, an angry feminist, and a dishevelled [[alcoholic]] named "Chugalug". ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== {{Refbegin}} *{{gcdb|type=credit|search=Howard+Post|title=Howard Post}} *{{comicbookdb|type=creator|id=5138|title=Howard Post}} {{Refend}} ==External links== *{{imdb name|0692827}} ===Interviews=== {{morefootnotes|section}} *[http://www.twomorrows.com/comicbookartist/articles/05post.html Interview with Howard Post] {{DEFAULTSORT:Post, Howard}} [[Category:People from New York]] [[it:Howard Post]]
